Class Summary
Address This class represents a dotted-string address that can be used to identify a unicast (address of a router or host), multicast or broadcast address.
AddressComparator This class compares two addresses (both can contain wildcards) and determines which entry should logically come first.
Bootstrap Bootstrap class used to start an application, while appending a URL to the classpath.
Configurator Very simple utility class that provides configuration facilities.
ControlData ControlData messages carry topology and management information.
CostMetricUnit This class determines the cost of the link between an interface and its peer.
DistanceTable An array of these items form a distance table.
DistanceTableComparator This class is used compare two entries from the distance table and determine which should logically come first in the distance table.
DistanceVector This is the triplet that defines a routing table entry in ExBF.
DummyInterceptor Simple concrete interceptor implementation.
HelloData This control message is send by new routers to their neighbors to announce their presence.
InterfaceState This state implementation defines the different states an interface can be in.
InterfaceTester  
Kernel This class implements the forwarding algorithm.
ListenerState Represents the state of the TCPListener class.
ManagableConfigurator This is the class that is exposed in JMX.
Message The Message class is the base class of all messages.
MessageInputStream
MessageInterceptor  
MessageOutputStream This implementation uses an escape character to separate messages.
MessagePriority This class defines priority levels for Messages.
MessagingConfigurator This class is used to configure the messaging library.
MovingAverage Simple class that implements a moving average with a fixed period.
NotifyData The NotifyData class is used by routers to announce delivery problems.
ObjectFIFO Implementation according to chapter 18 of Paul Hyde's 'Java Thread Programming'.
PingData The ping message looks like this:
PingService Simple application that can ping any host in the network.
PingServiceImpl Implementation of a simple ping application.
PrioritizedObjectFIFO This class implements a datastructure comparable to that of the ObjectFIFO, but with priorities.
RoutablePing
RoutingData A RoutingData message contains distance vectors from a neighbor.
Scheduler A singleton version of java.util.Timer
SimpleRouter This is a very simple application that starts the messaging library and then just sits and waits.
SimpleSink The SimpleSink application is a utility class that can be used to listen for messages sent to a certain address.
SimpleSource Simple source application that reads text on standard input and sends every line of text entered on the console as a separate UserData message to the destination addresses specified at the command line.
SocketReader The SocketReader takes care of reading the TCP socket of an interface.
SocketWriter The SocketWriter class is used by the TCPInterface to handle outgoing packets.
State The State object represents the state of an object or module.
TCPConnectionInitializer This class is used to initialize an incoming TCP connection before passing it to the right interface instance.
TCPInterface The TCPInterface class is the actual implementation of an interface that connects to a neighbor.
TCPListener Internal class that handles incoming connections for all interface instances.
TestClass Some test used to manually test individual things with - please ignore.
TracerouteService This application traces the path from this node to any specified destination address.
TracerouteServiceImpl This application traces the path from this node to any specified destination address.
Transport The Transport class is the heart of the messaging library.
Usage This class is the default class that is run when the mxs-messaging jar file is started with java -jar.
UserData The UserData message looks like this:
Version
 

Exception Summary
DeserializeException  
InterfaceIDException Thrown by the MessagingConfigurator class when the user is trying to add or remove interfaces with non-existing or non-unique ID's.
InvalidAddressException Thrown by the Address class when fed with an address identifier that is not syntactically correct.
InvalidStateException Thrown by the activate() and deactivate() method of various classes when these methods are invoked while the class is in an invalid state.
MaxInterfaceException  
SerializeException RuntimeException for convenience (professional exception ignoring ;) Hey, it's a proof of concept!
